item.title: *cry*
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

newbiehacker:

mopar, there's a way to make the menu's popup in front... let me look

EDIT:
found it:
JPopupMenu.setDefaultLightWeightPopupEnabled(false);

I thought I had tried that, but maybe not, Ill see, thanks :)[br][size=1]Posted at: May 31, 2006, 10:03:41 am[/size][hr]Works perfectly, thanks alot

Read full topic

item.title: *cry*
item.dc:creator: @newbiehacker newbiehacker
item.description:
@newbiehacker wrote:

mopar, there's a way to make the menu's popup in front... let me look

EDIT:
found it:
JPopupMenu.setDefaultLightWeightPopupEnabled(false);

item.title: *cry*
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Krichevskoy:

Mopar, what's this about a web client?

Im writing a webclient in java (I define webclient as like swiftswitch if your familiar with it, basically like a browser that loads the applet in its original page at runescape.com) Its going to have normal webclient features, such as autologin, hiscore lookup, spammer, screenshot capabilities and maybe an autoclicker, it will also have a midi player and an mp3 player(maybe)

for the main part of it that most will use, I am implementing regex's scar-java sharedmemory thing so they can talk to each other, and with this I am allowing SCAR to tell the webclient to send mousemovements and keypresses to the applet, effectivaly giving you a undetectable perfectly working silent mouse, so you can auto as many characters as your computer will allow

While making this Ive discoverd why noone has ever made a webclient in java before, because its a royal pain in the ass, I had to cut the ads and menus out of the client with php because I couldnt find a clean way to do it in java (im still trying to find a better way to do this, check my thread here for info on that endeavor)

The main problem I have run into right now is with the damn GUI, I havent used this much before, and its causing me immense pain, for some reason the jmenus want to popup behind the main jpanel, therefore hiding the entire menu

one last thing:(damn this is a long post) should I make all of this into one webclient? or seperate the SCAR thing into another one with no fancy features?

[/threadhijack]

Read full topic

XxXFoRbIdDeNXxX:

OK we have 3 people already. And if you are not interested DON'T POST HERE. PM or post your MSN here.

Req = Basic JAVA skills. :)[/quote]
[quote="Rencuz, post:11, topic:3335"]lol i know about java i know how play runescape is that enaugh

my favorite is this one by rencuz, it made me laugh irl

I thought I was making it clear enough when I locked all the aryan boards and made a single "aryan is dead" board, apparantly not though, I would like to think after awhile they would all just go away when they realize it is never coming back, but Im getting the impression they wont

We can just ignore them, or I could add a filter to change "Aryan" into "The bot that is never coming back, EVER"

maybe some of them will be satisfied when my new client comes out so they can auto multiple accounts with SCAR, but then most of them will probably bitch about having to run 2 programs to auto 1 character, so idk
